{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly and accumulation of highly branched glycogen called limit dextrins. This suggests a disorder affecting glycogen metabolism. Von Gierke's disease is the only one among the options that specifically involves an accumulation of abnormal glycogen (limit dextrins). Therefore, it is likely to be the correct diagnosis.", "answer_choice": "C"}
